subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
goals__remit: Macra na Feirme is a voluntary organisation for rural young people between the ages of 17 and 35. The organisation consists of a nationwide network of 200 clubs with approx 8,000 members. There are six key areas of activity: agriculture, sport, travel, public speaking, performing arts and community involvement. The organisation is primarily focused upon supporting the current and emerging needs of young farmers in their efforts to become established as viable and sustainable agri entrepreneurs. Macra na Feirme is committed to the personal development of members and puts emphasis on social interaction and participation.
